Class AStarPathFinder

  • java.lang.Object
    • AStarPathFinder

  • public class AStarPathFinder
extends java.lang.Object
    A path finding class which determines the shortest path from one point on a grid to the other in the most efficient manner

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int HEURISTIC_DIAGONAL 
      static int HEURISTIC_MANHATTAN 
      static int HEURISTIC_NONE 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AStarPathFinder(Grid gridIn)
      Creates the Pathfinder using the default heuristic, the manhattan method
      AStarPathFinder(Grid gridIn, int heuristicType)
      Creates the pathfinder using the given heuristic type

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Path findPath(java.awt.Point start, java.awt.Point end)
      Finds the shortest path from start to end on the grid supplied in the constructor.
      double getLastTimeTaken()
      Returns how long it took to find the most recent path.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AStarPathFinder

        public AStarPathFinder(Grid gridIn)
        Creates the Pathfinder using the default heuristic, the manhattan method
        Parameters:
        gridIn - The grid to find a path on.

      • AStarPathFinder

        public AStarPathFinder(Grid gridIn,
               int heuristicType)
        Creates the pathfinder using the given heuristic type
        Parameters:
        gridIn - The grid to find a path on.
        heuristicType - This must be a 0 (no heuristic), 1 (Manhattan heuristic) or 2 (Diagonal heuristic).

    • Method Detail

      • findPath

        public Path findPath(java.awt.Point start,
            java.awt.Point end)
        Finds the shortest path from start to end on the grid supplied in the constructor.
        Parameters:
        start - The starting point, as a 2D coordinate on the grid.
        end - The destination point, as a 2D coordinate on the grid.
        Returns:
        The shortest path from start to end.

      • getLastTimeTaken

        public double getLastTimeTaken()
        Returns how long it took to find the most recent path.
        Returns:
        The time taken (in milliseconds).
